list_definition.definition: a kind of pale yellow spring flower common in woods and hedges.

list_ex_of_english: There are no preparations containing evening primrose oil which hold a product license for the treatment of arthritis.
Flowers present in the area include gentian, primrose, cyclamen, violets and the lily.
The pink primrose has glaborous (smooth) to pubescent stems that grow to 50 cm in height.
We did not take the primrose path of irresponsible criticism and abstention.
There is not a single primrose in there to-day, but every single village garden has primroses.
In that statement, he went as far as he reasonably could down the road towards open government, without being sidetracked into the primrose path of ungovernability.
No evening primrose oil product is licensed for the treatment of arthritis.
Neither evening primrose oil nor borage seed oil taken orally have been shown to be effective.
